verification.note: Tolerance of 10^-3 (0.1%) is appropriate for numerical BSD verification because: 1) The regulator is computed from Mordell-Weil generators using floating-point height pairing, 2) The L-series leading term uses numerical approximation of complex integrals, 3) The period lattice computation involves transcendental integrals. Higher precision verification would require SageMath with increased precision settings. The relative difference of 1.71e-04 is well within typical numerical accuracy for BSD computations.

tolerance_explanation.justification: Standard tolerance for numerical BSD verification in literature
sources_of_error: Finite precision in regulator computation from height pairing
Numerical approximation in L-series derivative evaluation
tolerance_explanation.achievable_precision: Higher precision possible with SageMath prec=100+ digits
